intro: Sclerolaena astrocarpa, commonly known as the starfruit shrub, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit, which is edible, is a small, round, and often star-shaped structure. Sclerolaena astrocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
